newsitem.title: LEBANON: Katyusha rockets from Lebanon hit Israel border.
newsitem.headline: Katyusha rockets from Lebanon hit Israel border.

text.p: Suspected pro-Iranian Hizbollah guerrillas fired several Katyusha rockets which hit Israel's border with south Lebanon late on Wednesday, a pro-Israeli militia source said.
"A number of Katyusha rockets were fired from outside the Israel occupation zone and landed at the Israeli border. Some may have hit northern Israel," said the source.
Residents said they saw more than 30 Katyusha rockets fired towards the security zone Israel occupies inside south Lebanon.
There were no immediate reports of casualties and Hizbollah was not immediately available for confirmation of the rocket attacks.
Residents said some rockets had landed near the Israeli outpost of Blat inside the zone.
The rockets were fired one day after Hizbollah (Party of God) threatened to carry out suicide bombings inside Israel and Arab land occupied by the Jewish state.
